com.yantra.api.ydm

Interface createShipment

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.YDMApi, YIFApi

    public interface createShipment

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document createShipment(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The createShipment API is used to create a new shipment.

    • Method Detail

      • createShipment

        org.w3c.dom.Document createShipment(YFSEnvironment env,
                                    org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                             throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                    java.rmi.RemoteException

        The createShipment API is used to create a new shipment. A shipment is a collection of order lines that can be shipped together. After a shipment has been created, it can be picked, packed and shipped. Additionally, you can create a Delivery Plan and create one or more Loads for these Shipments.


        If shipment has to be created for an order release, either OrderReleases or ShipmentLines element has to be passed with the release details. If OrderReleases element is passed, shipment lines will be created from the order release and if the order line item has tag attributes specified, that will be copied as shipment line requested tag attributes.

          In the scenerio where the Carrier sends the load updates with the Load Shipment details before the shipment updates arrive, manageLoad API creates a Load Shipment record without the complete shipment details. If the shipment corresponding to the Load Shipment record is created, the Load Shipment record is updated with the Shipment information. This Creation of Load Shipment records while creating load without the prescence of the shipment is available only if the rule Creation Of Load Without Shipment Allowed is enabled in the configuration.

        In case of Outbound Shipments:
        • If Resource Planning is enabled for the ShipNode, planned tasks are created upon creation of shipments. This is done to determine the effort required by various resource pools to complete different activities like pick, pack and ship, inside the warehouse.
        • Shipment group is determined based on the attributes during creation time and the shipment is then assigned this shipment group.


        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        After creating the shipment, the createShipment API calls the changeShipment API to add all of the OrderReleases or ShipmentLines passed in the input XML. So, for all the other validations, refer to the changeShipment API.

        User Exits:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSGetItemSubstitutesOverrideUE
        See the changeShipment API for User Exits.

        Events Raised:
        See the changeShipment API for Events Raised.

        Audits:
        See the changeShipment API.

        Pre-conditions: None

        Post-conditions: None

        Output Template Support: Yes

        Database Extensibility Support: Yes

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        An XML that contains all the information about the Shipment. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.

        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
